akn:content.akn:p: (a) In general A State shall use a portion of the amounts provided under a grant awarded under section 300ff–21 of this title to establish a program under section 300ff–22(b)(3)(B) of this title to provide therapeutics to treat HIV/AIDS or prevent the serious deterioration of health arising from HIV/AIDS in eligible individuals, including measures for the prevention and treatment of opportunistic infections.

(d) Duties of Secretary In carrying out this section, the Secretary shall review the current status of State drug reimbursement programs established under section 300ff–22(2) 11 See References in Text note below. of this title and assess barriers to the expanded availability of the treatments described in subsection (a). The Secretary shall also examine the extent to which States coordinate with other grantees under this subchapter to reduce barriers to the expanded availability of the treatments described in subsection (a).

akn:subsection.akn:heading: List of classes of core antiretroviral therapeutics

akn:content.akn:p: (e) List of classes of core antiretroviral therapeutics For purposes of subsection (c)(1), the Secretary shall develop and maintain a list of classes of core antiretroviral therapeutics, which list shall be based on the therapeutics included in the guidelines of the Secretary known as the Clinical Practice Guidelines for Use of HIV/AIDS Drugs, relating to drugs needed to manage symptoms associated with HIV. The preceding sentence does not affect the authority of the Secretary to modify such Guidelines.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Use of health insurance and plans

akn:content.akn:p: (f) Use of health insurance and plans

(g) Drug rebate program A State shall ensure that any drug rebates received on drugs purchased from funds provided pursuant to this section are applied to activities supported under this subpart, with priority given to activities described under this section.
